body: You know, I was just thinking this earlier today... I was imagining something panda themed... ahem.
oh u want to be punnish ... lol i was thinking of just using the 3d bar plot from the logo on the website which i've already made...but if ur game to make a "pandas" one i like  that too

_It would have to not look like a child drew it in ms paint back in 1994... which rules out any attempt I'd make._

Graph icon definitely improvement, and matches current logo. :)
Can we use the first (blue) one? If you squint a bit, you could see it as a panda...

i've got something for this but static images are not tracked by docs...how can i get them into the docs?

![pandas_favicon32x32](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/417981/690250/5d4ccd68-dad9-11e2-88cf-bd82a59b661a.png)

All you have to do is put it at <root>/favicon.ico, right?

On Fri, Jun 21, 2013 at 9:16 PM, Phillip Cloud notifications@github.comwrote:

> i've got something for this but static images are not tracked by
> docs...how can i get them into the docs?
> 
> [image: pandas_favicon32x32]https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/417981/690250/5d4ccd68-dad9-11e2-88cf-bd82a59b661a.png
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/pydata/pandas/issues/3825#issuecomment-19848333
> .
relative to the static path in `source` which is `_static`...duh i can just make git track it
it's not big at all like 2k i think. i used `pngout` to smash the orig images and then `png2ico` to make the `ico` there's a 16x16 and 32x32 in the file as per the sphinx recommendations
nah there's an issue with uploading the icon....might revisit later if i have time

[Wes tweeted about this](https://twitter.com/wesmckinn/status/360828506378219523):

> Any #pydata friends want to lend a hand in designing a pandas logo or some form of branding? It's long overdue.

![Panda wearing bandana](https://encrypted-tbn2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQ9pPyWIfNlubqCG63xzFzthgfDHgdegDv7wFCXatLydmDLewATVP_0Y70)

Do you like this abstract looking panda face?
![pandas](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/711404/1060009/e81f5920-11a6-11e3-8a54-777ea55dcade.png)
@katychuang looks a little bit like a spinal cord :)

I really like this, but it is already taken by [Alberta ladies hockey team](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alberta_Pandas_women%27s_ice_hockey):

![Alberta pandas](http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/1/17/Alberta_Pandas_Logo.jpg)

and just for fun (I made one): 

![my panda](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1931852/1126573/84e411f0-1b26-11e3-908c-2e24b6182f87.png)

Some hipster douchbag definitely needs to port aalib over to emoji and grab some stars.

oops, attribution: http://www.flickr.com/photos/12587661@N06/11502320753/sizes/l/
I, uhm, modified the image.

It would be nice to have a favicon for the pandas documentation pages! Is pandas still in search for an official logo? A friend of mine might be able to help design one if you are interested.

If you're not looking for a logo any longer, could a favicon be made from [the logo on the homepage](https://pandas.pydata.org/_static/pandas_logo.png)? Maybe using one of the three plots in the logo, such as the rightmost one would look good?
